title: Pub licensing hours to be extended for VE Day
text:
Pub licensing hours in England and Wales are to be extended to mark the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe day next year.

Priti Patel, the Home Secretary, announced that pubs, clubs and bars which are licensed to trade until 11pm will be allowed to open until 1am on both Friday 8 May and Saturday 9 May 2020.

It follows the Government’s decision to move the early May bank holiday in 2020 from Monday, May 4th, to Friday, May 8th, to make the 75th anniversary of VE Day a public holiday.
